sentence.Network_en: The contest becomes mainly one of feint and counterfeint.
sentence.Network_cn: 这场比赛变成了一场以佯攻与反佯攻为主的较量.

sentence.Network_en: Make a feint to the east but attack in the west.
The boy made a feint of studying hard, though actually he was listening to the radio.
sentence.Network_cn: 这孩子实际上正在听收音机, 却假装着在用功.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French feinte, past participle (used as a noun) of feindre 'feign'

entry.def: In sport or military conflict, if someone feints, they make a brief movement in a different direction from the one they intend to follow, as a way of confusing or deceiving their opponent.

example.ex: I feinted to the left, then to the right...
example.tran: 我先佯作向左然后再向右。

example.ex: They feinted and concentrated forces against the most fortified line of the enemy side.
example.tran: 他们虚晃一招，然后集中兵力攻打敌方最坚固的阵线。

means.word_mean: 1. any distracting or deceptive maneuver (as a mock attack)
